intro: Guajava leptoclada, commonly known as the slender guajava, is a species of flowering plant in the family Anacardiaceae. It is native to parts of Central and South America, particularly in tropical regions with high humidity. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that eventually develop into edible fruits. Its botanical features include a woody stem, opposite leaf arrangement, and a distinctive fruit structure. It is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils.
